org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream

Class ConnectedDataStream<IN1,IN2>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream.ConnectedDataStream<IN1,IN2>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN1 - Type of the first input data steam.
    IN2 - Type of the second input data stream.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoBatchedDataStream

    public class ConnectedDataStream<IN1,IN2>
extends Object
    The ConnectedDataStream represents a stream for two different data types. It can be used to apply transformations like CoMapFunction on two DataStreams

      • groupBy

        public ConnectedDataStream<IN1,IN2> groupBy(int keyPosition1,
                                            int keyPosition2)
        GroupBy operation for connected data stream. Groups the elements of input1 and input2 according to keyPosition1 and keyPosition2. Used for applying function on grouped data streams for example reduce(org.apache.flink.streaming.api.function.co.CoReduceFunction<IN1, IN2, OUT>)
        Parameters:
        keyPosition1 - The field used to compute the hashcode of the elements in the first input stream.
        keyPosition2 - The field used to compute the hashcode of the elements in the second input stream.
        Returns:
        @return The transformed ConnectedDataStream

      • batch

        public CoBatchedDataStream<IN1,IN2> batch(long batchSize1,
                                          long batchSize2,
                                          long slideSize1,
                                          long slideSize2)
        Batch operation for connected data stream. Collects each input data stream's elements simultaneously into sliding batches creating a new CoBatchedDataStream. Then the user can apply reduce(org.apache.flink.streaming.api.function.co.CoReduceFunction<IN1, IN2, OUT>) transformation on the CoBatchedDataStream.
        Parameters:
        batchSize1 - The number of elements in each batch of the first input data stream
        batchSize2 - The number of elements in each batch of the second input data stream
        slideSize1 - The number of elements with which the batches of the first input data stream are slid by after each transformation.
        slideSize2 - The number of elements with which the batches of the second input data stream are slid by after each transformation.
        Returns:
        The transformed ConnectedDataStream

      • batch

        public CoBatchedDataStream<IN1,IN2> batch(long batchSize1,
                                          long batchSize2)
        Batch operation for connected data stream. Collects each input data stream's elements simultaneously into batches creating a new CoBatchedDataStream. Then the user can apply reduce(org.apache.flink.streaming.api.function.co.CoReduceFunction<IN1, IN2, OUT>) transformation on the CoBatchedDataStream.
        Parameters:
        batchSize1 - The number of elements in each batch of the first input data stream
        batchSize2 - The number of elements in each batch of the second input data stream
        Returns:
        The transformed ConnectedDataStream

      • window

        public CoWindowDataStream<IN1,IN2> window(long windowSize1,
                                          long windowSize2,
                                          long slideInterval1,
                                          long slideInterval2,
                                          TimeStamp<IN1> timeStamp1,
                                          TimeStamp<IN2> timeStamp2)
        Window operation for connected data stream. Collects each input data stream's elements simultaneously into sliding windows creating a new CoWindowDataStream. Then the user can apply BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>) transformation on the CoWindowDataStream. The user can implement their own time stamps or use the system time by default.
        Parameters:
        windowSize1 - The length of the window of the first input data stream
        windowSize2 - The length of the window of the second input data stream
        slideInterval1 - The number of milliseconds with which the windows of the first input data stream are slid by after each transformation
        slideInterval2 - The number of milliseconds with which the windows of the second input data stream are slid by after each transformation
        timeStamp1 - User defined function for extracting time-stamps from each element of the first input data stream
        timeStamp2 - User defined function for extracting time-stamps from each element of the second input data stream
        Returns:
        The transformed ConnectedDataStream

      • window

        public CoWindowDataStream<IN1,IN2> window(long windowSize1,
                                          long windowSize2,
                                          long slideInterval1,
                                          long slideInterval2)
        Window operation for connected data stream. Collects each input data stream's elements simultaneously into sliding windows creating a new CoWindowDataStream. Then the user can apply BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>) transformation on the CoWindowDataStream.
        Parameters:
        windowSize1 - The length of the window of the first input data stream in milliseconds.
        windowSize2 - The length of the window of the second input data stream in milliseconds.
        slideInterval1 - The number of milliseconds with which the windows of the first input data stream are slid by after each transformation
        slideInterval2 - The number of milliseconds with which the windows of the second input data stream are slid by after each transformation
        Returns:
        The transformed ConnectedDataStream

      • window

        public CoWindowDataStream<IN1,IN2> window(long windowSize1,
                                          long windowSize2,
                                          TimeStamp<IN1> timeStamp1,
                                          TimeStamp<IN2> timeStamp2)
        Window operation for connected data stream. Collects each input data stream's elements simultaneously into windows creating a new CoWindowDataStream. Then the user can apply BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>) transformation on the CoWindowDataStream. The user can implement their own time stamps or use the system time by default.
        Parameters:
        windowSize1 - The length of the window of the first input data stream
        windowSize2 - The length of the window of the second input data stream
        timeStamp1 - User defined function for extracting time-stamps from each element of the first input data stream
        timeStamp2 - User defined function for extracting time-stamps from each element of the second input data stream
        Returns:
        The transformed ConnectedDataStream

      • window

        public CoWindowDataStream<IN1,IN2> window(long windowSize1,
                                          long windowSize2)
        Window operation for connected data stream. Collects each input data stream's elements simultaneously into windows creating a new CoWindowDataStream. Then the user can apply BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>) transformation on the CoWindowDataStream.
        Parameters:
        windowSize1 - The length of the window of the first input data stream in milliseconds
        windowSize2 - The length of the window of the second input data stream in milliseconds
        Returns:
        The transformed ConnectedDataStream

      • map

        public <OUT> SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> map(CoMapFunction<IN1,IN2,OUT> coMapper)
        Applies a CoMap transformation on a ConnectedDataStream and maps the output to a common type. The transformation calls a CoMapFunction.map1(IN1) for each element of the first input and CoMapFunction.map2(IN2) for each element of the second input. Each CoMapFunction call returns exactly one element. The user can also extend RichCoMapFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFuntion interface.
        Parameters:
        coMapper - The CoMapFunction used to jointly transform the two input DataStreams
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

      • flatMap

        public <OUT> SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> flatMap(CoFlatMapFunction<IN1,IN2,OUT> coFlatMapper)
        Applies a CoFlatMap transformation on a ConnectedDataStream and maps the output to a common type. The transformation calls a CoFlatMapFunction.flatMap1(IN1, org.apache.flink.util.Collector<OUT>) for each element of the first input and CoFlatMapFunction.flatMap2(IN2, org.apache.flink.util.Collector<OUT>) for each element of the second input. Each CoFlatMapFunction call returns any number of elements including none. The user can also extend RichFlatMapFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFuntion interface.
        Parameters:
        coFlatMapper - The CoFlatMapFunction used to jointly transform the two input DataStreams
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

      • reduce

        public <OUT> SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> reduce(CoReduceFunction<IN1,IN2,OUT> coReducer)
        Applies a reduce transformation on a ConnectedDataStream and maps the outputs to a common type. If the ConnectedDataStream is batched or windowed then the reduce transformation is applied on every sliding batch/window of the data stream. If the connected data stream is grouped then the reducer is applied on every group of elements sharing the same key. This type of reduce is much faster than reduceGroup since the reduce function can be applied incrementally. The user can also extend the RichCoReduceFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFuntion interface.
        Parameters:
        coReducer - The CoReduceFunction that will be called for every element of the inputs.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • windowReduce

        public <OUT> SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> windowReduce(CoWindowFunction<IN1,IN2,OUT> coWindowFunction,
                                                            long windowSize,
                                                            long slideInterval)
        Applies a CoWindow transformation on the connected DataStreams. The transformation calls the CoWindowFunction.coWindow(java.util.List<IN1>, java.util.List<IN2>, org.apache.flink.util.Collector<O>) method for for time aligned windows of the two data streams. System time is used as default to compute windows.
        Parameters:
        coWindowFunction - The CoWindowFunction that will be applied for the time windows.
        windowSize - Size of the windows that will be aligned for both streams in milliseconds.
        slideInterval - After every function call the windows will be slid by this interval.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • windowReduce

        public <OUT> SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> windowReduce(CoWindowFunction<IN1,IN2,OUT> coWindowFunction,
                                                            long windowSize,
                                                            long slideInterval,
                                                            TimeStamp<IN1> timestamp1,
                                                            TimeStamp<IN2> timestamp2)
        Applies a CoWindow transformation on the connected DataStreams. The transformation calls the CoWindowFunction.coWindow(java.util.List<IN1>, java.util.List<IN2>, org.apache.flink.util.Collector<O>) method for time aligned windows of the two data streams. The user can implement their own time stamps or use the system time by default.
        Parameters:
        coWindowFunction - The CoWindowFunction that will be applied for the time windows.
        windowSize - Size of the windows that will be aligned for both streams. If system time is used it is milliseconds. User defined time stamps are assumed to be monotonically increasing.
        slideInterval - After every function call the windows will be slid by this interval.
        timestamp1 - User defined time stamps for the first input.
        timestamp2 - User defined time stamps for the second input.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.
